IRS990.MissionDesc: THE HILL SCHOOL PREPARES STUDENTS FROM ACROSS THE COUNTRY AND AROUND THE WORLD FOR COLLEGE, CAREERS AND LIFE. WITHIN A FAMILY SCHOOL ENVIRONMENT AND A RIGOROUS LIBERAL ARTS CURRICULUM, WE CHALLENGE OUR YOUNG PEOPLE TO WORK HARD; THINK AND REASON; BE FULFILLED; SERVE THE COMMON GOOD; AND BE PREPARED TO LEAD AS CITIZENS OF THE WORLD, UNIQUELY GUIDED BY OUR MOTTO, "WHATSOEVER THINGS ARE TRUE."
IRS990.Desc: THE HILL SCHOOL PROVIDES A CHALLENGING CURRICULUM TO ITS 502 STUDENTS EMPHASIZING CRITICAL THINKING AND WRITING. A TOTAL OF 28 ADVANCED PLACEMENT COURSES WERE OFFERED AS WELL AS AN ARRAY OF HONORS CLASSES AND INDEPENDENT STUDIES. HILL STUDENTS ARE ACTIVE IN ATHLETICS, THE ARTS, STUDENT-RUN ORGANIZATIONS AND COMMUNITY SERVICE. HILL STUDENTS ARE DRAWN FROM 25 STATES AND 25 FOREIGN COUNTRIES. THE TYPICAL CLASS SIZE IS 12-14 STUDENTS WITH A STUDENT/TEACHER RATIO OF 7:1.

USAddress.AddressLine1Txt: THE HILL SCHOOL 717 E HIGH STREET

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: PRIVATE EQUITY AND REAL ESTATE PARTNERSHIPS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL MAINTAINS THREE COLLECTIONS; N.C. WYETH PAINTINGS, DUCK STAMPS AND AUDUBON PRINTS. THESE ARE ALL DISPLAYED FOR THE EDUCATION OF OUR STUDENTS. THE WYETH PAINTINGS DEPICT HISTORICAL BATTLES THAT SHAPED U.S. HISTORY. THE DUCK STAMPS AND AUDUBON PRINTS ARE VISUAL AIDS FOR THE STUDENTS STUDYING BIRDS.

MANAGEMENT HAS REVIEWED THE TAX POSITIONS FOR EACH OF THE OPEN TAX YEARS (JUNE 30, 2013 - JUNE 30, 2015) OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN THE SCHOOL'S TAX RETURN FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2016 AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT THERE ARE NO SIGNIFICANT UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

IN 2015-2016, THE HILL SCHOOL'S STUDENT BODY OF 377 BOARDING STUDENTS AND 125 DAY STUDENTS WAS DRAWN FROM 25 STATES, AND 25 FOREIGN COUNTRIES. THE SCHOOL HAS ALWAYS HAD A NON-DISCRIMINATORY POLICY, WHICH HAS BEEN APPROVED BY THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES, AND THIS POLICY IS STATED IN ALL OF THE MAJOR SCHOOL PUBLICATIONS. THE STUDENT BODY CONSISTS OF AFRICAN-AMERICANS AND OTHER STUDENTS FROM RACIAL MINORITY GROUPS AS WELL AS NATIVE STUDENTS FROM AUSTRALIA, BOTSWANA, CANADA, CHINA, ENGLAND, HONG KONG, JAPAN, MEXICO, POLAND, RUSSIA, SINGAPORE, SOUTH AFRICA, SOUTH KOREA, SPAIN, SWEDEN, THAILAND, TURKEY AND VIETNAM.

THE FINANCIAL AID COMMITTEE REVIEWS APPLICATIONS FOR AID SUBMITTED THROUGH SSS OF PRINCETON, COPIES OF PARENT'S FEDERAL TAX RETURNS AND ANY OTHER INFORMATION OFFERED BY THE APPLICANTS. ALL RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED BY THE DIRECTOR OF FINANCIAL AID. AID IS AWARDED BASED ON THE NEED AS DETERMINED BY THE SSS CALCULATIONS. ALL FINANCIAL AID THAT IS AWARDED IS CREDITED TO THE TUITION BILLING FOR THE STUDENT. ALL AID IS USED TO REDUCE THE TUITION PAYABLE.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: MONTGOMERY COUNTY HIGHER EDUCATION AND HEALTH AUTHORITY
MONTGOMERY COUNTY HIGHER EDUCATION AND HEALTH AUTHORITY

BusTrInvolveInterestedPrsnGrp.TransactionDesc: SERVED AS VICE PRESIDENT OF EXPRESS DATA SYSTEMS, THE COMPANY THAT HANDLES THE SCHOOL'S PAYROLL PROCESSING. MR. BERMAN'S DAUGHTER IS THE PRESIDENT OF THE COMPANY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL UTILIZES THE SERVICES OF A DISCOUNT BROKER TO SELL ALL SECURITIES RECEIVED.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN OUTSIDE CPA FIRM AND THEN IS REVIEWED BY THE OFFICERS. IT IS THEN GIVEN TO THE FULL BOARD OF TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ASSISTANT SECRETARY SENDS A SURVEY TO ALL SENIOR STAFF AND TRUSTEES EVERY MAY. SHE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR MAKING SURE ALL REQUIRED PERSONS RETURN THE SURVEY. ALL POTENTIAL CONFLICTS NOTED IN THE SURVEY RESPONSES ARE THEN FORWARDED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR REVIEW. ANY INTERESTED TRUSTEE WILL RECUSE HIM/HERSELF WHEN CASES ARE BROUGHT TO THE ENTIRE BOARD FOR APPROVAL.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SCHOOL COLLECTS SALARY INFORMATION FROM A GROUP OF 40 BOARDING SCHOOLS FOR ALL KEY EMPLOYEE POSITIONS. THIS INFORMATION IS REVIEWED BY A COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES FOR SETTING THE HEADMASTER'S SALARY. THE HEADMASTER USES THIS INFORMATION IN SETTING THE SALARIES FOR THE REST OF THE SCHOOL EMPLOYEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT MAKE ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC.
ACTUARIAL LOSS ON ANNUITY OBLIGATIONS AND LIFE INCOME FUNDS -77,747. GAIN ON EXTINGUISHMENT OF DEBT 447,824.

THE PROCESS BY WHICH THE ORGANIZATION APPOINTS A COMMITTEE THAT ASSUMES RESPONSIBILITY FOR OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AND SELECTION OF AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.
